alert.note: Alert for Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 03 at 9:02AM EDT until May 03 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: .A prolonged period of rainy weather continues to result in high streamflows and pockets of minor flooding, especially in the smaller, flashier basins across the higher terrain. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Maine, including the following counties, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 AM EDT, Doppler and automated rain gauges radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area over the next 24 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Farmington, Rumford, Dixfield, Andover, Weld, Mexico, Phillips, Wilton, Grafton and Carthage.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
